ygData.subject: Re: Selos Accelerando
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Snow does slow you down noticably. Ice however is just like snow. After spending the last few days in Everfrost I really think somewhat slippery ice would
ygData.messageBody:
> I haven't noticed any speed difference, 'slippery' effect or change in
> stamina with sand, grass, road, snow or ice. Only difference I notice is
> the textures (which can affect your perception of your speed).


Snow does slow you down noticably. Ice however is just like snow. After
spending the last few days in Everfrost I really think somewhat slippery ice
would be a *good* thing, obnoxious yes, but would add challenge to the area.
BTW, while there I did a corpse retreive for a guy that, while fighting a
Shaman first fell into a hole inthe ice and THEN got rooted...man that has
to suck...I was glad to see Selos still breaks root, every time the Snow Orc
shaman cast root I was thinking "that's it big boy, spend all that mana on
root..." *laughs*


Tszaaz D'Kith, Scarlet Moon
